channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AL

item.title: Report X-2024020921
item.description:
Report X-2024020921

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-20T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-05
  • City: THEODORE
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Glass inner glass bottles broke and leaked contents. Certified QA was alerted and hazmat was placed in secure cage DescribePack: Glass bottles shattered DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Absorbent was used to soak up leak and shoveled into hazmat drum. Damaged Hazmat placed in secure cage

item.title: Report E-2024020354
item.description:
Report E-2024020354

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-20T00:32:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-23
  • City: EASTABOGA
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FUEL SOUTH EXPRESS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 20 gallons of diesel were released due to mechanical failure while offloading. The release impacted asphalt and concrete in a 34' x 43' and 20' x 4' area. No storm drains or waterways were reported to be impacted by the release. Absorbents were applied to the spill. Hepaco generated 2-55 gallon poly waste drums containing the absorbents used to clean the release and transported the waste off-site to their facility.
